messages.content: 9-1-1, what's your emergency?
I shot my husband.
Okay. What's the address of your emergency?
Watch my drive.
Okay. What's the phone number you're calling from?
Tell me exactly what happened.
He shot me several times.
Okay. Hold on for me.
Okay.
All right, ma'am. Are you with your husband now?
He took his weapon and walked down the hall.
Okay. How old is your husband?
Is he awake? Is he breathing?
Yes.
He is breathing? Okay. Tell me your name.
All right, you're on the phone with me, okay? And what I need for you to do is put that gun down, okay?
It's in the living room.
Okay. I do have the ambulance on the way. Is there any serious bleeding?
The way he's lying, I can't tell, but it should be.
Okay. Where did you shoot him?
I'm not sure.
He was trying to shoot you?
Yeah, my deadline was at one o'clock. I'm supposed to die at one o'clock.
So he was trying to shoot you too and you took the gun from him?
Oh, you have a gun.
Okay, and you have both guns now?
I gave him one and I reached for the other one. He started firing.
Okay, so he shot at you, and you shot at him?
Yes.
Are you injured?
I'm not really sure.
Okay. Just stay on the phone with me. I have EMS, police, and fire department coming. Where is he in the house?
Where are you in the house?
I got all over it.
Okay. You don't have the gun in your hand?
No.
What's going on?
It's the police.
Okay. Step outside and do what they say. Just go ahead and put the gun down.
They're here.
Okay. Just put the phone down and do what they say.
Okay.
